meanings.definition: The action of damaging the good reputation of someone.
meanings.sent1: The defamations against him spread quickly in the small town.
meanings.sent2: The defamations in the newspaper caused a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The defamations were so outrageous that they became the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her defamations were like poison, spreading through the community.
meanings.sent5: The defamations left a lasting mark on his reputation.

meanings.definition: False spoken statements about someone that damages their reputation.
meanings.sent1: She was devastated by the defamations made against her.
meanings.sent2: The defamations were proven to be completely untrue.
meanings.sent3: The defamations were so silly that no one believed them.
meanings.sent4: His defamations were like arrows aimed at her character.
meanings.sent5: The defamations cut deep, leaving scars on her reputation.

meanings.definition: The act of harming the reputation of someone by making false statements.
meanings.sent1: He was sued for his defamations against the company.
meanings.sent2: The defamations were meant to tarnish her image.
meanings.sent3: The defamations were like a bad joke gone too far.
meanings.sent4: Her defamations were like a storm cloud over his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The defamations painted a dark picture of his character.
